p: The mean scores (men and women) for the sensory attributes of the studied chocolates prepared from mixtures of medicinal plants and fruits are shown in Figure 6. The highest appreciated was the VHC2 sample which obtained a mean score of 4.8 for overall acceptability, 4.6 for color, 4.5 for consistency, 4.7 for flavor and 4.8 for taste, thus falling within the 4.5–5.00 score range which indicates high acceptability (HA). The VHC1 test falls within the 3.5–4.49 level of acceptability (acceptable—A) for consistency, color and taste; in terms of aroma and overall acceptability, it falls into the highly acceptable class (HA) ( Figure 6). Similar studies regarding sensory evaluation of chocolate have been carried out by Iserliyska et al. in 2007 and Norhayati and Mohd in 2014 [ 91, 92].
